title: The 8 Best Hotels for Families in South America
text:
Tierra Atacama 
Many people will not consider South America when they are thinking about taking a family vacation, but it is a continent that has some amazing sights and some of the most interesting experiences that you will not be able to find elsewhere. 
Adapting to the language difference and the cultural change will often actually be more difficult for adults than it is for children and teenagers, and they will often be just as keen to explore as you are. There is also plenty of suitable accommodation to be found on the continent, and here are eight of the best hotels for your family vacation. Txai Resort, Itacare, Brazil 
This eco friendly resort is located on a remote but beautiful part of the Brazilian coast a short distance from the city of Bahia, and it is a great place to spend some quality family time. There are some exciting activities for older kids including canoeing and rafting, while there is a dedicated children's swimming pool and loft rooms available in the family accommodation. Finca Santa Anita, Salta, Argentina 
If your children love animals, then this traditional family farm is one of the best places in Argentina to visit, as here they will get to meet horses, goats, chickens and dogs, as they can learn how the farm works. 
The six children of Valentina and Carlos are involved in the running of the farm and the accommodation, and this can be a wonderful educational experience as there is goats cheese production and horse riding among the activities. Tierra Atacama Hotel, San Pedro de Atacama, Chile 
The Atacama desert is not usually the obvious destination for family vacations, but here there are plenty of things to do including astronomy at night, trips to see the flamingos at the lake and taking a dip in the hot spring. Back at the hotel, there is plenty of space to run and play, along with an indoor and an outdoor pool where they can play. Country Club Lima Hotel, Peru 
This hotel offers an island of peace in the busy capital city of Peru, and it is a great base from which to explore the different attractions of the city, including the Chocolate Museum and the amazing paragliders over the cliffs of Miraflores . All of the restaurants have high chairs and there are cribs available in all rooms for those traveling with young children. Estancia Peuma Hue, Bariloche, Argentina 
Another rural paradise among the foothills of the Andes, this estancia offers cabins as well as rooms in the large country house, and there is plenty of space to play for your children. The lake is a wonderful place for kayaking, while those who love animals will love the guided horse trekking to some of the remote areas in the hills behind the house. Royal Decameron Baru, Isla Baru, Colombia 
This is an idyllic location for a beach holiday, with a stretch of golden sand right by the hotel, and a safe area for swimming, while there are tours to Punta Icacos by canoe and also trips to the mud baths. There are plenty of things to do around the hotel to tire out the children with a daily activities program, swimming pool and tennis courts. Cabanas Isla Del Sol, Esmeraldas, Ecuador 
Near the lovely town of Esmeraldas in Ecuador, this rustic beach resort is one that is a great place to unwind, with a lovely beach just yards away and a nice swimming pool for children to play. Kayaks and body boards are available to rent for older children, while the whale spotting tours are a remarkable and memorable experience for young people and adults alike. Fasano Rio, Ipanema, Brazil 
If you are looking to visit Rio in style, then this modern hotel designed with a 1950s atmosphere is certainly one of the most luxurious in the city, and Ipanema beach is just yards from the front door of the hotel. Teddy bears are provided for babies arriving at the hotel, while younger children will get a cup of warm milk and a cookie, while the rooftop pool is great for kids and there is also a nanny service available.
